Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels are 54-79 this season and they have lost seven games in a row.
Los Angeles has lost the first two games in this series and they have only scored two runs in each game.
Prior to this series, the Angels lost all four against the Blue Jays, lost two out of three against the Royals, and lost two out of three against the Braves.
Los Angeles is just 2-13 in their last 15 games and they are last in the AL West.
The Los Angeles pitching staff has a 4.58 ERA, a 1.32 WHIP, and a .242 opponent batting average.
The Angels offense has scored 519 runs with a .231 batting average and a .303 on base percentage.
Zach Neto is batting .254 with 19 home runs and 64 RBI’s for the Angels this season.
The Detroit Tigers are 68-66 this year and they have won six games in a row.
Detroit has won the first two games in this series by scores of 6-2 and 3-2.
Prior to this series, the Tigers swept the White Sox, lost two out of three against the Cubs, and won two out of three against the Yankees.
Detroit is 9-2 in their last 11 games and they are third in the AL Central.
The Detroit pitching staff has a 3.79 ERA, a 1.19 WHIP, and a .237 opponent batting average.
The Tigers offense has scored 571 runs with a .234 batting average and a .297 on base percentage.
Riley Greene is batting .262 with 19 home runs and 56 RBI’s for the Tigers this season.
The projected starting pitcher for Los Angeles is Jack Kochanowicz, who is 1-3 with a 6.08 ERA and a 1.54 WHIP over 26.2 innings pitched this year.
Kochanowicz has allowed two earned runs in two of his last three starts.
The projected starting pitcher for Detroit is Keider Montero, who is 4-5 with a 5.15 ERA and a 1.33 WHIP over 64.2 innings pitched this season.
Montero has allowed two earned runs or fewer in three of his last four starts.
